title: WCCP-FM
text:
WCCP-FM (105.5 <a href="Hertz">MHz</a>) is a <a href="commercial%20radio">commercial</a> <a href="radio%20station">radio station</a> in <a href="Clemson%2C%20South%20Carolina">Clemson, South Carolina</a>. It is owned by the Byrne Acquisition Group, headed by John Byrne, and it broadcasts a <a href="sports%20radio">sports</a> <a href="radio%20format">format</a> known as "The Roar". Weekdays it has a line up of local sports hosts. Nights and weekends, it carries <a href="CBS%20Sports%20Radio">CBS Sports Radio</a>. Programming is <a href="simulcast">simulcast</a> on <a href="WAHT">WAHT</a> <a href="1560%20AM">1560 AM</a> in <a href="Cowpens%2C%20South%20Carolina">Cowpens, South Carolina</a>, and on its <a href="FM%20translator">FM translator</a> at 97.5 MHz.
WCCP-FM has an <a href="effective%20radiated%20power">effective radiated power</a> (ERP) of 20,000 <a href="watt">watt</a>s. The <a href="transmitter">transmitter</a> is off Harper Road in <a href="Pendleton%2C%20South%20Carolina">Pendleton, South Carolina</a>.
Station history.
WCCP-FM <a href="sign-on">signed on</a> the air on April 8, 1993 at 104.9 MHz. It was an <a href="oldies">oldies</a> station using the name "Foothills 104.9", but switched to all-sports by the end of the decade. Tommy Powell was mainly responsible for getting WCCP-FM 104.9 on the air. Since 2003, WCCP-FM has been the <a href="flagship%20%28broadcasting%29">flagship</a> radio station for <a href="Clemson%20University">Clemson University</a> athletics. It also carries <a href="Atlanta%20Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a> <a href="NFL">football</a> and <a href="Atlanta%20Braves">Atlanta Braves</a> <a href="MLB">baseball</a> games.
On May 5, 2014, WCCP-FM moved from 104.9 FM to 105.5 FM and rebranded as "105.5 The Roar".
